Job Posting:175242 - Position: S26 2026 Technology Summer Analyst Program (Calgary) 175242B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 11/14/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 11/07/2025 03:20 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Morgan Stanley Capital Group 700 Wellington St Montreal H3C 2N6 QC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode 2026 - Summer S26 2026 Technology Summer Analyst Program (Calgary) 175242B Co-op Position Calgary, AB Canada 4 months To be confirmed Salary Currency CAD Salary Job Description Job # 19156 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List Morgan Stanley has a rich history and culture of technology innovation, allowing the firm to stay on the cutting-edge and solve highly complex business and technology problems in finance, capital markets and wealth and asset management. Our teams of world-class technologists continuously explore opportunities emerging from new technologies, build innovative solutions and establish partnerships with emerging technology players to deliver new and innovative solutions. Additionally, Morgan Stanley has been consecutively named one of Canada's Top Employers for Young People. Morgan Stanley Wealth Management Technology is the global technology department responsible for the design, development, delivery and support of the technical solutions behind the products and services used by the Morgan Stanley Wealth Management business, such as Morgan Stanley At Work which provides workplace financial solutions for organizations and their employees, combining personalized advice and education with modern technology. Morgan Stanley Wealth Management Technology works with large scale databases, proprietary and non-proprietary messaging software, a broad variety of vendor products, numerous financial exchanges and regulatory entities, and a wide range of programming languages. Placement and Duration Summer Analysts (14 weeks, May - Aug) are recruited and placed into a specific development team. These programs are designed to offer a real world, project-based experience of what it's like to be a technologist for a top financial Firm. Training Program Summer Analysts will participate in an induction day that provides an overview of the Firm, followed by direct placement into their teams. In addition to working on a live project, program highlights include senior management networking events, technical demonstrations, team-building opportunities and participation in the Firm's community service initiatives. Responsibilities • Development Teams: Our development teams design, develop and maintain applications used by our business units. Daily activities include meeting with clients to gather and analyze requirements. They make system design decisions, evaluating, integrating and developing necessary software, and then test and deploy applications to production. Developing high-performing, low-latency electronic trading systems, and evolving complex workflows and life-cycle management capabilities are just some of the projects available for developers. Job Requirements Qualifications/Skills/Requirements. • Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 • Possess excellent problem-solving, communication, teamwork and analytical skills. • Experience in the financial services sector is not required. • As a Development/Infrastructure candidate, you must be studying towards a Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or other related technical majors. Superior technical skills, including a strong understanding of Linux/Unix and Windows, competency in at least one programming language (e.g., C, C++, Python, Scala, Java or C#), as well as experience in object-oriented development, good comprehension of data structures, algorithms and complexity theory, strong database and scripting skills. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: morganstanley.com/careers/students-graduates/opportunities/19156 Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
